ground_truth: Meanwhile, water floods the cargo hold, knocking down the two stewards. In the front well deck, Jack pushes Rose back as the ship breaks off chunks of ice, which land on the deck and knock down two men. The ship continues moving alongside the iceberg. In the engine room, water pours in as a man scrambles past furnace stokers swept across. Jack runs to the starboard railing and watches as the back of the ship moves alongside the iceberg. Murdoch runs to the bridge and moves a lever, which closes the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. A man motions to the stokers. Workers run through the rising water and crawl under the lowering doors. He follows the others through one of the doorways. The door closes, leaving several stokers behind. As the others escape past closing doors, the remaining stoker dives under the last closing door and falls out as its steel hatch slams shut. On the bridge, a row of lights blinks on the watertight door indicator panel. Murdoch stares at the panel, then turns away. On the passenger deck, a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail and peer at the iceberg. In the crow's nest, Fleet turns to Lee. Jack, Rose, and the two men peer over the railing at the iceberg, now behind the ship. On the bridge, Murdoch addresses Moody. Moody glances at a wall clock as he exits. Hichens turns to the bridge door as Captain Smith enters. Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge deck. Smith peers down from the bridge deck shelter, then stands at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well deck. Murdoch hurries off. In his cabin, Fabrizio jumps down from his bunk into inch-deep water and turns on the overhead light. His roommates follow as he opens the door. Tommy approaches. The countess steps out of her stateroom and stops a mustached steward. Andrews hurries past, carrying blueprints. Outside, smoke rises from the ship's huge funnels as people gather on the decks. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow running rats down a hallway. Cal and Lovejoy step out of the sitting room and stop a dark-haired steward in the hallway. The steward hurries off. On the upper deck, a dark-haired man tosses a blond man a chunk of ice. He tosses the ice back. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass Jack and Rose. The master-at-arms studies Jack's drawings. Cal snatches the drawings from him. Holding hands, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who stands in the hallway. Lovejoy walks alongside Jack and slips the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket. Lovejoy follows Rose and Jack into the sitting room. Cal steps forward. Cal glances at Lovejoy, who arches his eyebrows.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, liquid inundates the freight compartment, knocking down the two attendants. In the front well platform, Jack shoves Rose back as the vessel fractures off pieces of frost, which land on the platform and topple two men. The vessel continues gliding alongside the glacier. In the engine chamber, liquid cascades in as a man scrambles past furnace stokers swept across. Jack dashes to the starboard railing and observes as the rear of the vessel glides alongside the glacier. Murdoch rushes to the bridge and shifts a lever, which closes the hydraulic watertight gateways in the engine chamber. A man gestures to the stokers. Workers dash through the rising liquid and crawl under the lowering gateways. He follows the others through one of the doorways. The gateway shuts, leaving several stokers behind. As the others escape past closing gateways, the remaining stoker dives under the last closing gateway and falls out as its steel hatch slams shut. On the bridge, a row of illuminations blinks on the watertight gateway indicator panel. Murdoch gazes at the panel, then turns away. On the passenger platform, a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail and gaze at the glacier. In the crow's nest, Fleet turns to Lee. Jack, Rose, and the two men gaze over the railing at the glacier, now behind the vessel. On the bridge, Murdoch addresses Moody. Moody glances at a wall chronometer as he exits. Hichens turns to the bridge gateway as Captain Smith enters. Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge platform. Smith gazes down from the bridge platform shelter, then stands at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well platform. Murdoch hurries off. In his cabin, Fabrizio leaps down from his bunk into inch-deep liquid and switches on the overhead illumination. His roommates follow as he opens the gateway. Tommy approaches. The countess steps out of her stateroom and halts a mustached attendant. Andrews rushes past, carrying schematics. Outside, smoke ascends from the vessel's enormous smokestacks as individuals gather on the platforms. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow scampering rodents down a passageway. Cal and Lovejoy step out of the sitting chamber and halt a dark-haired attendant in the passageway. The attendant rushes off. On the upper platform, a dark-haired man tosses a blond man a piece of frost. He tosses the frost back. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass Jack and Rose. The master-at-arms examines Jack's sketches. Cal snatches the sketches from him. Holding hands, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who stands in the passageway. Lovejoy walks alongside Jack and slips the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket. Lovejoy follows Rose and Jack into the sitting chamber. Cal steps forward. Cal glances at Lovejoy, who raises his eyebrows.

In the front well deck, Rose is pushed back by Jack as chunks of ice are broken off the ship, land on the deck, and two men are knocked down. The iceberg is continued to be moved alongside by the ship. In the engine room, a man scrambles past as water is poured in, sweeping across furnace stokers. The starboard railing is run to by Jack, who watches as the iceberg is moved alongside by the back of the ship. A lever is moved by Murdoch as he runs to the bridge, closing the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. The stokers are motioned to by a man. The rising water is run through by the workers who crawl under the lowering doors. The others are followed by him through one of the doorways. Several stokers are left behind as the door is closed. As the closing doors are escaped past by the others, the last closing door is dived under by the remaining stoker, who falls out as its steel hatch is slammed shut. A row of lights blinks on the watertight door indicator panel as it is stared at by Murdoch, who then turns away. A man and a woman lean over the starboard rail on the passenger deck, peering at the iceberg. Fleet turns to Lee in the crow's nest. The iceberg, now behind the ship, is peered over at by Jack, Rose, and the two men from the railing. Moody is addressed by Murdoch on the bridge. As he exits, a wall clock is glanced at by Moody. The bridge door is turned to by Hichens as Captain Smith enters. Smith is followed by Murdoch onto the bridge deck. The front well deck is overlooked by Smith as he stands at the bridge railing, peering down from the bridge deck shelter. Murdoch hurries off. Fabrizio jumps down from his bunk into inch-deep water in his cabin and turns on the overhead light. As he opens the door, he is followed by his roommates. Tommy approaches. The countess stops a mustached steward as she steps out of her stateroom. Andrews hurries past, carrying blueprints. Smoke rises from the ship's huge funnels as people gather on the decks. Running rats are followed down a hallway by Tommy, Fabrizio, and others. A dark-haired steward is stopped by Cal and Lovejoy as they step out of the sitting room in the hallway. The steward hurries off. On the upper deck, a blond man is tossed a chunk of ice by a dark-haired man. The ice is tossed back by him. Jack and Rose are passed by Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch. Jack's drawings are studied by the master-at-arms. The drawings are snatched from him by Cal. Lovejoy, standing in the hallway, is approached by Jack and Rose holding hands. The heart of the ocean is slipped into Jack's coat pocket by Lovejoy as he walks alongside him. Rose and Jack are followed by Lovejoy into the sitting room. Cal steps forward. Lovejoy, who arches his eyebrows, is glanced at by Cal.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, water begins to flood the cargo hold, forcefully knocking down the two stewards who are caught off guard. In the front well deck area, Jack instinctively pushes Rose back as the ship breaks off large chunks of ice, which crash onto the deck and knock down two unsuspecting men. The ship continues its perilous journey, moving alongside the massive iceberg. In the engine room, water pours in relentlessly as a man scrambles past the furnace stokers, who are being swept across the floor. Jack quickly runs to the starboard railing and watches intently as the back of the ship moves alongside the towering iceberg. Murdoch rushes to the bridge and urgently moves a lever, which activates the mechanism to close the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. A man signals to the stokers, and workers frantically run through the rising water, crawling under the rapidly lowering doors. He follows the others through one of the narrow doorways. The door closes with a heavy thud, leaving several stokers trapped behind. As the others manage to escape past the closing doors, the remaining stoker makes a desperate dive under the last closing door and falls out just as its steel hatch slams shut with a resounding clang. On the bridge, a row of lights blinks on the watertight door indicator panel, catching Murdoch's attention. He stares at the panel for a moment, then turns away. On the passenger deck, a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail, peering curiously at the iceberg. In the crow's nest, Fleet turns to Lee with a concerned expression. Jack, Rose, and the two men peer over the railing at the iceberg, which is now behind the ship. On the bridge, Murdoch addresses Moody, who glances at a wall clock as he exits. Hichens turns to the bridge door as Captain Smith enters with a determined look. Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge deck. Smith peers down from the bridge deck shelter, then stands at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well deck with a serious expression. Murdoch hurries off to attend to other urgent matters. In his cabin, Fabrizio jumps down from his bunk into inch-deep water and quickly turns on the overhead light. His roommates follow him as he opens the door. Tommy approaches with a concerned look. The countess steps out of her stateroom and stops a mustached steward to inquire about the situation. Andrews hurries past, carrying blueprints with a sense of urgency. Outside, smoke rises from the ship's huge funnels as people gather on the decks, murmuring in confusion. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow running rats down a hallway, sensing the impending danger. Cal and Lovejoy step out of the sitting room and stop a dark-haired steward in the hallway to ask questions. The steward hurries off, clearly in a rush. On the upper deck, a dark-haired man playfully tosses a blond man a chunk of ice, and he tosses it back with a grin. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass by Jack and Rose, who are standing together. The master-at-arms studies Jack's drawings with interest. Cal snatches the drawings from him with a swift motion. Holding hands, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who stands in the hallway with a watchful eye. Lovejoy walks alongside Jack and discreetly slips the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket. Lovejoy then follows Rose and Jack into the sitting room. Cal steps forward with a determined look. Cal glances at Lovejoy, who arches his eyebrows in response.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, as the situation unfolds with growing intensity, water begins to flood the cargo hold with an unstoppable force, violently knocking down the two unsuspecting stewards who are caught completely off guard. In the front well deck area, Jack, acting on pure instinct, quickly pushes Rose back just in time as the ship breaks off massive chunks of ice, which come crashing onto the deck and forcefully knock down two unsuspecting men. The ship relentlessly continues its perilous journey, moving dangerously close alongside the massive iceberg. In the engine room, water pours in relentlessly, creating chaos as a man scrambles frantically past the furnace stokers, who are being swept mercilessly across the floor. Jack, with a sense of urgency, quickly runs to the starboard railing, watching intently as the back of the ship edges alongside the towering iceberg. Murdoch rushes with haste to the bridge, urgently moving a lever that activates the critical mechanism designed to close the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. A man signals hurriedly to the stokers, and the workers frantically run through the rising water, crawling under the rapidly lowering doors. He follows the others through one of the narrow doorways just in time. The heavy door closes with a resounding thud, leaving several stokers trapped behind it. As others manage to escape past the closing doors, the remaining stoker makes a desperate dive under the last closing door, tumbling out just as its steel hatch slams shut with a resounding clang. On the bridge, a row of small lights begins to blink on the watertight door indicator panel, instantly catching Murdoch's attention. He stares thoughtfully at the panel for a moment, then turns away. On the passenger deck, a curious man and woman lean over the starboard rail, peering at the iceberg with interest. In the crow's nest, Fleet turns to Lee with a concerned expression etched on his face. Meanwhile, Jack, Rose, and the two men peer anxiously over the railing at the iceberg, now disappearing behind the ship. On the bridge, Murdoch speaks to Moody, who takes a quick glance at the wall clock as he exits. Hichens turns his attention toward the bridge door as Captain Smith enters with a determined look etched upon his face. Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge deck, standing by. Smith peers down from the bridge deck shelter, then stands firmly at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well deck with a serious expression. Murdoch hurries off to attend to other urgent matters, mindful of the gravity of the situation. In his cabin, Fabrizio jumps down hastily from his bunk into inch-deep water and quickly turns on the overhead light. His roommates follow him with concern as he opens the door. Tommy approaches with a worried look on his face. The countess steps gracefully out of her stateroom and stops a mustached steward to inquire about the unfolding situation. Andrews hurries past them, carrying blueprints with a marked sense of urgency. Outside, smoke rises ominously from the ship's huge funnels as people gather on the decks, murmuring to each other in confusion. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow a group of running rats down a dimly lit hallway, sensing the impending danger that looms. Cal and Lovejoy step deliberately out of the sitting room and stop a dark-haired steward in the hallway, asking questions. The steward hurries off, clearly in a rush to attend to pressing matters. On the upper deck, a dark-haired man playfully tosses a chunk of ice back to a blond man, who catches it and tosses it back with a grin. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass by Jack and Rose, who are standing together amid the chaos. The master-at-arms studies Jack's drawings intently with interest. Cal snatches the drawings from him with a swift motion, showing his determination. Holding hands, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who stands in the hallway with a watchful eye on them. Lovejoy walks alongside Jack and discreetly slips the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket without anyone noticing. Lovejoy then follows Rose and Jack into the sitting room with a calculated air. Cal steps forward with a look of determination, glancing at Lovejoy, who arches his eyebrows in response, signaling their unspoken understanding.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As water begins to flood the cargo hold, it surges in with force, causing the two stewards to lose their balance and fall. Simultaneously, on the front well deck, Jack instinctively pushes Rose back to protect her as the ship collides with the iceberg, breaking off large chunks of ice that crash onto the deck, knocking down two unsuspecting men. The ship continues its perilous journey alongside the iceberg, maintaining its course. In the engine room, water gushes in, creating chaos as a man frantically scrambles past the furnace stokers, who are being swept away by the incoming deluge. Jack quickly makes his way to the starboard railing, where he stands and watches intently as the back of the ship glides alongside the massive iceberg. Murdoch, in a state of urgency, rushes to the bridge and decisively moves a lever, triggering the hydraulic system to close the watertight doors in the engine room. A man signals to the stokers, prompting them to run through the rapidly rising water and crawl under the descending doors. He follows the others through one of the doorways just in time. The door closes with a heavy thud, leaving several stokers trapped behind. As the others manage to escape through the closing doors, one remaining stoker makes a desperate dive under the last closing door, narrowly escaping as the steel hatch slams shut behind him. On the bridge, a row of lights flickers on the watertight door indicator panel, capturing Murdoch's attention. He stares at the panel for a moment, then turns away, contemplating the situation. Meanwhile, on the passenger deck, a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail, peering curiously at the iceberg as it drifts away. In the crow's nest, Fleet turns to Lee, sharing a moment of realization. Jack, Rose, and the two men join in, peering over the railing at the iceberg, now receding into the distance behind the ship. On the bridge, Murdoch addresses Moody, who glances at a wall clock before making his exit. Hichens turns his attention to the bridge door as Captain Smith enters with a sense of urgency. Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge deck, where Smith peers down from the bridge deck shelter, assessing the situation below, then stands at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well deck with a grave expression. Murdoch hurries off to attend to his duties. In his cabin, Fabrizio jumps down from his bunk into the inch-deep water that has begun to accumulate and quickly turns on the overhead light to assess the situation. His roommates follow suit as he opens the door to investigate further. Tommy approaches, joining the growing concern. The countess steps out of her stateroom, stopping a mustached steward to inquire about the situation. Andrews hurries past, clutching blueprints, focused on finding a solution. Outside, smoke billows from the ship's massive funnels as people gather on the decks, drawn by the commotion. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow a trail of running rats down a hallway, a sign of impending danger. Cal and Lovejoy step out of the sitting room, stopping a dark-haired steward in the hallway to demand information. The steward, sensing the urgency, hurries off to fulfill his duties. On the upper deck, a dark-haired man playfully tosses a chunk of ice to a blond man, who catches it and tosses it back, unaware of the gravity of the situation. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass by Jack and Rose, who are caught up in the unfolding drama. The master-at-arms examines Jack's drawings with interest, only for Cal to snatch them away with a sense of entitlement. Holding hands, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who stands in the hallway with a calculating demeanor. As they pass, Lovejoy discreetly walks alongside Jack and slyly slips the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket, a move filled with ulterior motives. Lovejoy then follows Rose and Jack into the sitting room, where Cal steps forward, his presence commanding attention. Cal glances at Lovejoy, who responds with a subtle arch of his eyebrows, signaling a shared understanding between them.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: As water floods the cargo hold, knocking down two stewards, Jack pushes Rose back on the front well deck as the ship breaks off chunks of ice, which land on the deck and knock down two men. The ship continues alongside the iceberg. In the engine room, water pours in as a man scrambles past furnace stokers swept across. Jack runs to the starboard railing, watching the ship move alongside the iceberg. Murdoch rushes to the bridge, closing the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. Workers run through rising water, crawling under lowering doors, with one stoker diving under the last closing door just in time. On the bridge, Murdoch observes the blinking lights on the watertight door indicator panel before turning away. On the passenger deck, a couple peers at the iceberg, now behind the ship, as Fleet turns to Lee in the crow's nest. Murdoch addresses Moody on the bridge, who checks the time before exiting. Captain Smith enters, followed by Murdoch, and peers down from the bridge deck shelter. In his cabin, Fabrizio jumps from his bunk into inch-deep water, turning on the light as his roommates follow him out. Tommy approaches as the countess stops a steward, and Andrews hurries past with blueprints. Outside, smoke rises from the funnels as people gather on the decks. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow running rats down a hallway. Cal and Lovejoy step out, stopping a steward who hurries off. On the upper deck, a man tosses ice to another. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass Jack and Rose, as the master-at-arms examines Jack's drawings, which Cal snatches. Holding hands, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who slips the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket and follows them into the sitting room, where Cal steps forward and exchanges a glance with Lovejoy.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, water floods the cargo hold, knocking down the two stewards, who were responsible for ensuring the passengers' needs were met during the voyage. In the front well deck, an area used for storing ropes and equipment, Jack pushes Rose back as the ship breaks off chunks of ice, which land on the deck and knock down two men. The ship, known as RMS Titanic, continues moving alongside the iceberg that it famously struck on its maiden voyage in April 1912. In the engine room, water pours in as a man scrambles past furnace stokers swept across the floor, desperately trying to maintain steam pressure for the engines. Jack runs to the starboard railing and watches as the back of the ship moves alongside the iceberg. Murdoch, the ship's First Officer, runs to the bridge and moves a lever, which closes the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. A man motions to the stokers, directing them to safety as they work tirelessly to keep the ship running. Workers run through the rising water and crawl under the lowering doors, crucial elements designed as a safety feature to prevent flooding. He follows the others through one of the doorways. The door closes, leaving several stokers behind, trapped in the engine room. As the others escape past closing doors, the remaining stoker dives under the last closing door and falls out as its steel hatch slams shut, showcasing the perilous conditions they faced. On the bridge, a row of lights blinks on the watertight door indicator panel, alerting the crew to the status of each door. Murdoch stares at the panel, comprehending the grave situation, then turns away. On the passenger deck, where passengers stroll and enjoy the sea air, a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail and peer at the iceberg. In the crow's nest, the lookout post high above the deck, Fleet turns to Lee. Jack, Rose, and the two men peer over the railing at the iceberg, now behind the ship, realizing the danger they narrowly escaped. On the bridge, Murdoch addresses Moody, the Sixth Officer. Moody glances at a wall clock as he exits, noting the time for the ship's records. Hichens, the ship's quartermaster, turns to the bridge door as Captain Smith enters, a seasoned captain known for his calm demeanor. Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge deck. Smith peers down from the bridge deck shelter, then stands at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well deck, assessing the situation below. Murdoch hurries off. In his cabin, Fabrizio jumps down from his bunk into inch-deep water and turns on the overhead light, alarmed by the flooding. His roommates follow as he opens the door. Tommy, another third-class passenger, approaches. The countess, one of the wealthy passengers onboard, steps out of her stateroom and stops a mustached steward. Andrews, the ship's designer, hurries past, carrying blueprints of the ship's layout, likely reviewing the damage. Outside, smoke rises from the ship's huge funnels as people gather on the decks. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow running rats down a hallway, a sign of the ship's dire state. Cal, a wealthy first-class passenger, and Lovejoy, his valet, step out of the sitting room and stop a dark-haired steward in the hallway. The steward hurries off, possibly to alert others. On the upper deck, a dark-haired man tosses a blond man a chunk of ice, playfully engaging with the debris. He tosses the ice back, unaware of the impending disaster. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass Jack and Rose. The master-at-arms, responsible for security onboard, studies Jack's drawings. Cal snatches the drawings from him, suspicious of Jack's intentions. Holding hands, Jack and Rose, romantically entangled despite their different social classes, approach Lovejoy, who stands in the hallway. Lovejoy walks alongside Jack and slips the heart of the ocean, a valuable blue diamond, into Jack's coat pocket, framing him for theft. Lovejoy follows Rose and Jack into the sitting room. Cal steps forward, intent on confronting them. Cal glances at Lovejoy, who arches his eyebrows, signaling their complicity in the scheme.

test_cases.description: Meanwhile water floods the cargo hold knocking down the two stewards. In the front well deck Jack pushes Rose back as the ship breaks off chunks of ice which land on the deck and knock down two men. The ship continues moving alongside the iceberg. In the engine room water pours in as a man scrambles past furnace stokers swept across. Jack runs to the starboard railing and watches as the back of the ship moves alongside the iceberg. Murdoch runs to the bridge and moves a lever which closes the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. A man motions to the stokers. Workers run through the rising water and crawl under the lowering doors. He follows the others through one of the doorways. The door closes leaving several stokers behind. As the others escape past closing doors the remaining stoker dives under the last closing door and falls out as its steel hatch slams shut. On the bridge a row of lights blinks on the watertight door. indicator panel. Murdoch stares at the panel then turns away. On the passenger deck a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail and peer at the iceberg. In the crow's nest Fleet turns to Lee. Jack. Rose and the two men peer over the railing at the iceberg now behind the ship. On the bridge Murdoch addresses Moody. Moody glances at a wall clock as he exits. Hichens turns to the bridge door as Captain Smith enters. Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge deck. Smith peers down from the bridge deck shelter then stands at the bridge railing overlooking the front well deck. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. Murdoch hurries off. In his cabin. Fabrizio jumps down from his bunk into inchdeep water and turns on the overhead light. His roommates follow as he opens the door. Tommy approaches. The countess steps out of her stateroom and stops a mustached steward. Andrews hurries past carrying blueprints. Outside smoke rises from the ship's huge funnels. as people gather on the decks. Tommy Fabrizio and others follow running rats down a hallway. Cal and Lovejoy step out of the sitting room and stop a darkhaired steward in the hallway. The steward hurries off. On the upper deck a darkhaired man tosses a blond man. a chunk of ice. He tosses the ice back. Smith Moody Andrews and Murdoch pass Jack and Rose. The masteratarms studies Jack's drawings. Cal snatches the drawings from him. Holding hands Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy who stands in the hallway. Lovejoy walks alongside Jack and slips the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket. Lovejoy follows Rose and Jack into the sitting room. Cal steps forward. Cal glances at Lovejoy who arches his eyebrows.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, water floods the cargo hold, knocking down the two dancers. In the front well deck, the dog pushes the cat back as the ship breaks off chunks of ice, which land on the deck and knock down two superheroes. The ship continues moving alongside the iceberg. In the engine room, water pours in as a giraffe scrambles past furnace stokers swept across. The bird runs to the starboard railing and watches as the back of the ship moves alongside the iceberg. The robot runs to the bridge and moves a lever, which closes the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. A lion motions to the stokers. Astronauts run through the rising water and crawl under the lowering doors. The penguin follows the others through one of the doorways. The door closes, leaving several stokers behind. As the others escape past closing doors, the remaining stoker dives under the last closing door and falls out as its steel hatch slams shut. On the bridge, a row of lights blinks on the watertight door indicator panel. The robot stares at the panel, then turns away. On the passenger deck, a wizard and a witch lean over the starboard rail and peer at the iceberg. In the crow's nest, the rabbit turns to the turtle. The dog, the cat, and the two superheroes peer over the railing at the iceberg, now behind the ship. On the bridge, the robot addresses the dragon. The dragon glances at a wall clock as the dragon exits. The unicorn turns to the bridge door as Captain Nemo enters. The robot follows Nemo onto the bridge deck. Nemo peers down from the bridge deck shelter, then stands at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well deck. The robot hurries off. In his cabin, the pirate jumps down from his bunk into inch-deep water and turns on the overhead light. His roommates follow as the pirate opens the door. The knight approaches. The queen steps out of her stateroom and stops a mustached acrobat. The wizard hurries past, carrying blueprints. Outside, smoke rises from the ship's huge funnels as people gather on the decks. The knight, the pirate, and others follow running rats down a hallway. The detective and the vampire step out of the sitting room and stop a dark-haired acrobat in the hallway. The acrobat hurries off. On the upper deck, a dark-haired alien tosses a blond alien a chunk of ice. The alien tosses the ice back. Nemo, the dragon, the wizard, and the robot pass the dog and the cat. The master-at-arms studies the dog's drawings. The detective snatches the drawings from the master-at-arms. Holding hands, the dog and the cat approach the vampire, who stands in the hallway. The vampire walks alongside the dog and slips the heart of the ocean into the dog's coat pocket. The vampire follows the cat and the dog into the sitting room. The detective steps forward. The detective glances at the vampire, who arches his eyebrows.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, rain floods the dining room, knocking down the two servers. In the front garden, Jack pushes Rose back as the train breaks off chunks of rock, which land on the path and knock down two men. The train continues moving alongside the cliff. In the control room, sand pours in as a man scrambles past engineers swept across. Jack runs to the starboard fence and watches as the back of the train moves alongside the cliff. Murdoch runs to the helm and moves a lever, which closes the hydraulic watertight windows in the control room. A man motions to the engineers. Workers run through the rising sand and crawl under the lowering windows. He follows the others through one of the gateways. The window closes, leaving several engineers behind. As the others escape past closing windows, the remaining engineer dives under the last closing window and falls out as its glass pane slams shut. On the helm, a sequence of bells rings on the watertight window indicator board. Murdoch stares at the board, then turns away. On the passenger path, a man and a woman lean over the starboard fence and peer at the cliff. In the look-out tower, Fleet turns to Lee. Jack, Rose, and the two men peer over the fence at the cliff, now behind the train. On the helm, Murdoch addresses Moody. Moody glances at a wall calendar as he exits. Hichens turns to the helm door as Captain Smith enters. Murdoch follows Smith onto the helm deck. Smith peers down from the helm deck shelter, then stands at the helm fence, overlooking the front garden. Murdoch hurries off. In his cabin, Fabrizio jumps down from his bed into inch-deep gravel and turns on the overhead fan. His roommates follow as he opens the door. Tommy approaches. The countess steps out of her bedroom and stops a mustached porter. Andrews hurries past, carrying maps. Outside, steam rises from the train's huge chimneys as people gather on the paths. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others follow running cats down a hallway. Cal and Lovejoy step out of the drawing room and stop a dark-haired porter in the hallway. The porter hurries off. On the top path, a dark-haired man tosses a blond man a chunk of rock. He tosses the rock back. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch pass Jack and Rose. The master-at-arms studies Jack's paintings. Cal snatches the paintings from him. Holding hands, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who stands in the hallway. Lovejoy walks alongside Jack and slips the sapphire of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket. Lovejoy follows Rose and Jack into the drawing room. Cal steps forward. Cal glances at Lovejoy, who arches his eyebrows.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, water fills the cargo hold, lifting the two stewards. In the front well deck, Jack pulls Rose forward as the ship collects chunks of ice, which rest on the deck and lift two men. The ship drifts alongside the iceberg. In the engine room, water trickles in as a man wanders past furnace stokers swept aside. Jack strolls to the starboard railing and listens as the back of the ship drifts alongside the iceberg. Murdoch walks to the bridge and adjusts a lever, which opens the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room. A man signals to the stokers. Workers skip through the rising water and jump under the lowering doors. He precedes the others through one of the doorways. The door opens, abandoning several stokers inside. As the others saunter past opening doors, the remaining stoker slides under the last opening door and tumbles out as its steel hatch swings shut. On the bridge, a row of lights fades on the watertight door indicator panel. Murdoch glares at the panel, then steps away. On the passenger deck, a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail and gaze at the iceberg. In the crow's nest, Fleet nods to Lee. Jack, Rose, and the two men gaze over the railing at the iceberg, now behind the ship. On the bridge, Murdoch converses with Moody. Moody checks a wall clock as he enters. Hichens turns to the bridge door as Captain Smith leaves. Murdoch trails Smith onto the bridge deck. Smith gazes up from the bridge deck shelter, then kneels at the bridge railing, overlooking the front well deck. Murdoch strolls off. In his cabin, Fabrizio crawls up from his bunk into inch-deep water and switches off the overhead light. His roommates trail as he closes the door. Tommy departs. The countess steps out of her stateroom and greets a mustached steward. Andrews ambles past, examining blueprints. Outside, smoke descends from the ship's huge funnels as people disperse on the decks. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others lead running rats up a hallway. Cal and Lovejoy emerge from the sitting room and greet a dark-haired steward in the hallway. The steward wanders off. On the upper deck, a dark-haired man hands a blond man a chunk of ice. He catches the ice back. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch join Jack and Rose. The master-at-arms studies Jack's scribbles. Cal grabs the scribbles from him. Holding hands, Jack and Rose retreat from Lovejoy, who stands in the hallway. Lovejoy follows away from Jack and places the heart of the ocean into Jack's coat pocket. Lovejoy departs from Rose and Jack into the sitting room. Cal steps back. Cal glances at Lovejoy, who shakes his eyebrows.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, coffee spills into the backpack, tripping over the two librarians. In the front garden shed, Sam pulls Laura back as the bicycle detaches pieces of glass, which fall onto the gazebo and trip over two cameras. The bicycle continues moving alongside the refrigerator. In the kitchen, coffee spills in as a squirrel scrambles past mirror painters swept across. Sam runs to the northern curtain and watches as the back of the bicycle moves alongside the refrigerator. Lawrence rushes to the attic and adjusts a switch, which closes the metallic velvet lockers in the kitchen. A monkey signals to the painters. Pirates dash through the rising coffee and crawl under the descending lockers. He follows the giraffes through one of the windows. The locker closes, leaving several painters behind. As the giraffes escape past closing lockers, the remaining painter dives under the last closing locker and tumbles out as its wooden panel slams shut. In the attic, a row of candles flickers on the velvet locker display board. Lawrence gazes at the board, then turns away. On the rooftop terrace, a cat and a dog lean over the northern curtain and squint at the refrigerator. In the crow's nest, Gold turns to Silver. Sam, Laura, and the two cameras squint over the curtain at the refrigerator, now behind the bicycle. In the attic, Lawrence speaks to Walker. Walker glances at a wristwatch as he leaves. Roberts turns to the attic door as Queen Harris enters. Lawrence follows Harris into the attic terrace. Harris gazes down from the attic terrace enclosure, then stands at the attic curtain, overlooking the front garden shed. Lawrence hurries off. In his bedroom, Alessandro hops down from his mattress into inch-deep coffee and activates the ceiling lamp. His parakeets follow as he opens the window. Jonah approaches. The duchess steps out of her ottoman and stops a bearded technician. Fitzpatrick hurries past, holding maps. Outside, fog rises from the bicycle's towering chimneys as scientists gather on the terraces. Jonah, Alessandro, and others trail running ants down a hallway. Mike and Gardner step out of the music room and halt a red-haired technician in the hallway. The technician rushes off. On the lower balcony, a red-haired giraffe hurls a gingerbread man a piece of glass. He hurls the glass back. Harris, Walker, Fitzpatrick, and Lawrence pass Sam and Laura. The captain-at-arms examines Sam's sketches. Mike grabs the sketches from him. Holding hands, Sam and Laura approach Gardner, who stands in the hallway. Gardner walks alongside Sam and sneaks the jewel of the desert into Sam's jacket pocket. Gardner follows Laura and Sam into the music room. Mike steps forward. Mike glances at Gardner, who raises his eyebrows.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, sunlight fills the cargo hold, lifting up the two mechanics. In the forward garden deck, Sam nudges Emma forward as the plane drops off clusters of snow, which settle on the deck and lift two women. The plane continues hovering alongside the glacier. In the kitchen area, daylight streams in as a woman dances past chefs twirling around. Sam skips to the port railing and observes as the front of the plane hovers alongside the glacier. Johnson skips to the dashboard and turns a knob, which opens the hydraulic porthole covers in the kitchen area. A woman gestures to the chefs. Performers skitter through the descending sunlight and slide through the opening windows. She follows the others through one of the passages. The window opens, leaving several chefs seated. As the others wander through open windows, the remaining chef vaults through the last open window and leaps up as its glass panel slides upward. On the dashboard, a row of lamps flickers on the porthole window indicator panel. Johnson glances at the panel, then walks away. On the outdoor terrace, a woman and a man lean over the port rail and gaze at the glacier. In the cockpit, Shepard turns to Lane. Sam, Emma, and the two women gaze over the railing at the glacier, now beside the plane. On the dashboard, Johnson mentions Barton. Barton checks a wall calendar as he leaves. Reilly turns to the cockpit door as Commander Jones enters. Johnson follows Jones onto the cockpit deck. Jones gazes up from the cockpit deck shelter, then leans at the cockpit railing, surveying the forward garden deck. Johnson strides off. In her lounge, Marco leaps up from her chair into knee-deep sunlight and switches off the overhead fan. Her colleagues join as she locks the window. Toby approaches. The duchess strides out of her suite and taps a bearded porter. Baxter glides past, holding maps. Inside, sparks fall from the plane's tall chimneys as guests assemble on the terraces. Toby, Marco, and others pursue flying birds up a pathway. Clark and Hargrave stumble out of the meeting area and greet a blonde woman in the pathway. The woman strides off. On the lower terrace, a blonde woman lobs a brunette woman a cluster of snow. She passes the snow back. Jones, Barton, Baxter, and Johnson bypass Sam and Emma. The officer examines Sam's paintings. Clark pulls the paintings from her. Holding postcards, Sam and Emma confront Hargrave, who waits in the pathway. Hargrave skips alongside Sam and slips the pearl of the sea into Sam's bag. Hargrave greets Emma and Sam in the meeting area. Clark strides backward. Clark nods at Hargrave, who raises his arms.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Meanwhile, sand fills the luggage compartment, sweeping aside the two attendants. In the front sun deck, Jack pulls Rose forward as the boat sheds pieces of glass, which rain onto the deck and trip two men. The boat continues drifting next to the glacier. In the control room, smoke drifts in as a man stumbles past the generator operators tossed around. Jack sprints to the port railing and observes as the front of the boat glides along the glacier. Murdoch rushes to the helm and turns a knob, which opens the pneumatic lift doors in the control room. A man signals to the operators. Workers sprint through the swirling smoke and slide beneath the closing doors. He tags along with the others through one of the doorways. The door opens, leaving several operators stranded. As the others vanish past opening doors, the remaining operator leaps over the last opening door and collapses as its wooden hatch snaps open. On the helm, a series of bells ring on the lift door indicator panel. Murdoch glares at the panel, then strides away. On the passenger deck, a man and a woman lean over the port rail and gaze at the glacier. In the lookout tower, Fleet nods to Lee. Jack, Rose, and the two men gaze over the railing at the glacier, now off the stern of the boat. On the helm, Murdoch confers with Moody. Moody checks a wristwatch as he departs. Hichens turns to the helm door as Captain Smith arrives. Murdoch trails Smith onto the helm deck. Smith examines the horizon from the helm deck shelter, then perches at the helm railing, surveying the front sun deck. Murdoch scurries away. In his cabin, Fabrizio steps up from his hammock into knee-deep sand and switches off the floor lamp. His roommates follow as he shuts the door. Tommy approaches. The duchess emerges from her suite and calls a bearded attendant. Andrews saunters past, lugging maps. Outside, fog descends from the boat's towering chimneys as people disperse on the decks. Tommy, Fabrizio, and others trail sprinting squirrels down a hallway. Cal and Lovejoy emerge from the dining room and intercept a fair-haired attendant in the hallway. The attendant scurries away. On the lower deck, a dark-haired man hands a red-haired man a piece of sand. He places the sand down. Smith, Moody, Andrews, and Murdoch stroll past Jack and Rose. The arms-master scrutinizes Jack's paintings. Cal seizes the paintings from him. Holding elbows, Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy, who leans against the hallway. Lovejoy strolls alongside Jack and sneaks the jewel of the ocean onto Jack's coat sleeve. Lovejoy trails Rose and Jack into the dining room. Cal steps back. Cal looks toward Lovejoy, who shakes his head.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Simultaneously, syrup overflows the sleeping pod, toppling the three architects. In the rear garden gate, Tom pulls Lily forward as the train sheds off clumps of dirt, which fall on the gate and topple three children. The train halts moving towards the mountain. In the control chamber, pebbles trickle as a lady doodles past lamp fixers carried away. Tom sprints to the port fence and marvels as the front of the train glides past the mountain. Johnson sprints to the deck and twists a knob, which opens the electric airtight windows in the control chamber. A lady gestures to the fixers. Painters dash above the rising dust and leap over the lifting windows. She tags behind others through one of the archways. The window opens, leaving a few fixers ahead. As others retreat beside open windows, the last fixer rolls beneath the first open window and climbs in as its wooden lid clamps open. On the deck, a line of bells chimes on the airtight window signal display. Johnson gawks at the display, then pivots away. On the leisure field, a child and a gentleman recline over the port fence and gaze at the mountain. In the lighthouse, Blake nods towards Liam. Tom, Lily, and the three children gaze over the fence at the mountain, now ahead of the train. On the deck, Johnson whispers to Moody. Moody peers at a sundial as he enters. Jenkins glimpses at the deck window as Admiral Clark exits. Johnson trails Clark onto the deck field. Clark gazes up from the deck field awning, then squats at the deck fence, observing the rear garden gate. Johnson ambles away. In his chamber, Roberto leaps up from the ladder onto foot-deep dust and turns off the bottom lamp. His neighbors wander as he closes the window. Timmy departs. The duchess climbs into her apartment and nudges a bearded architect. Andrews skitters by, holding suitcases. Indoors, fog descends from the train’s tiny chimneys as animals disperse from the fields. Timmy, Roberto, and creatures lead soaring parrots up a basement. Cal and Joyheart exit the painting room and bump into a light-haired architect in the basement. The architect strolls along. On the lower field, a light-haired girl hands a red-haired girl a piece of dirt. She hands the dirt over. Clark, Moody, Andrews, and Johnson greet Tom and Lily. The chief-at-operations divulges Tom's maps. Cal grabs the maps from her. Holding cats, Tom and Lily push past Joyheart, who sits in the basement. Joyheart skips in front of Tom and slides the jewel of the woods inside Tom's coat sleeve. Joyheart shuffles before Lily and Tom into the painting room. Cal hops backward. Cal beams at Joyheart, who lowers her hands.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As water floods the cargo hold, Jack and Rose face chaos as the ship scrapes against an iceberg, dislodging ice onto the deck. Water rushes into the engine room, forcing workers to escape through closing watertight doors. On the bridge, Murdoch closes the doors as Captain Smith evaluates the situation. Meanwhile, Fabrizio's cabin begins to flood, prompting him and his roommates to investigate. Andrews, carrying blueprints, and others, including Tommy and Fabrizio, rush through the ship. Cal and Lovejoy also make their way through the ship, Lovejoy slipping the heart of the ocean into Jack's pocket. Amidst the chaos, Jack and Rose confront Lovejoy in the hallway.

ocean into Jack's coat pocket  Holding hands Jack and Rose approach Lovejoy who stands in the hallway  Cal snatches the drawings from him  The masteratarms studies Jack's drawings  Smith Moody Andrews and Murdoch pass Jack and Rose  He tosses the ice back  a chunk of ice  On the upper deck a darkhaired man tosses a blond man  The steward hurries off  Cal and Lovejoy step out of the sitting room and stop a darkhaired steward in the hallway  Tommy Fabrizio and others follow running rats down a hallway  as people gather on the decks  Outside smoke rises from the ship's huge funnels  Andrews hurries past carrying blueprints  The countess steps out of her stateroom and stops a mustached steward  Tommy approaches  His roommates follow as he opens the door  Fabrizio jumps down from his bunk into inchdeep water and turns on the overhead light  In his cabin  Murdoch hurries off  Smith peers down from the bridge deck shelter then stands at the bridge railing overlooking the front well deck  Murdoch follows Smith onto the bridge deck  Hichens turns to the bridge door as Captain Smith enters  Moody glances at a wall clock as he exits  On the bridge Murdoch addresses Moody  Rose and the two men peer over the railing at the iceberg now behind the ship  Jack  In the crow's nest Fleet turns to Lee  On the passenger deck a man and a woman lean over the starboard rail and peer at the iceberg  Murdoch stares at the panel then turns away  indicator panel  On the bridge a row of lights blinks on the watertight door  As the others escape past closing doors the remaining stoker dives under the last closing door and falls out as its steel hatch slams shut  The door closes leaving several stokers behind  He follows the others through one of the doorways  Workers run through the rising water and crawl under the lowering doors  A man motions to the stokers  Murdoch runs to the bridge and moves a lever which closes the hydraulic watertight doors in the engine room  Jack runs to the starboard railing and watches as the back of the ship moves alongside the iceberg  In the engine room water pours in as a man scrambles past furnace stokers swept across  The ship continues moving alongside the iceberg  In the front well deck Jack pushes Rose back as the ship breaks off chunks of ice which land on the deck and knock down two men  Meanwhile water floods the cargo hold knocking down the two stewards
